snippet: The broad gains — which included double-digit increases by several automakers — came in a month that is traditionally slow for American dealerships.
abstract: Auto industry charts 14 percent increase in January sales, selling some 1.15 million vehicles domestically for an annualized rate of 16.66 million vehicles; rate is highest since 2006, and follows blockbuster sales in 2014.
lead_paragraph: The broad gains — which included double-digit increases by several automakers — came in a month that is traditionally slow for American dealerships.

headline.main: Auto Sales Stayed Strong in January, Bucking Trend for Month
headline.print_headline: Auto Sales Stayed Strong in January, Bucking Trend for Month

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
